intro: Monetia paleacea, commonly known as the paleaceas, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Monetia paleacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some areas.
